summary: This bill, the Modern Employment Reform, Improvement, and Transformation Act of 2025 (MERIT Act), aims to reform federal employment practices. It addresses employee performance and misconduct, modifies procedures for adverse actions, furloughs, and appeals. Key changes include repealing performance-based actions under Chapter 43, revising adverse action procedures, modifying the handling of senior executive performance, altering supervisor disciplinary processes, and extending probationary periods for both SES and competitive service employees. Additionally, the bill introduces provisions related to recouping bonuses/awards, reducing annuities for employees convicted of felonies, and outlines procedures for emergency furloughs.
